p: Over some regions, changes in heatwave amplitude (hottest heatwave day per season, Fig. 1d) are reasonably similar to increases in in global temperature. Over Australia and southeast Asia, heatwave amplitude is projected to increase approximately 1:1 with global temperature. For large parts of the world, the increase in heatwave amplitude is between 1.2–1.5 °C per degree of global warming, with values of up to 1.8 °C over the United States, parts of Africa and South America, and 2 °C over Europe.
